intro: Rapuntium puberulum, commonly known as the hairy rapunculus, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed and hairy, and its flowers are yellow with five petals. It produces a capsule fruit containing small, oval seeds. Rapuntium puberulum is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates.
